topic.title: What protocols I can use for building an infrastructure like ZeroNET?
topic.body: I need a distributed database and notifications. I need authenticity of users who in ZeroNET terminology will be zite and a decentralized search is needed for some properties (strings up to 256 bytes in length), which the zite owns. In principle, I understand that this is enough ZeroNET. That's just the applications should be extensions to chrome and work run as ZeroNET-peer on WebRTC eventually. The main thing is not this, but a problem is to quickly receive notifications and updates on some property. Therefore, I'm looking for some other protocol, although ZeroNET is convenient as a store of static web pages. Probably distributed database is not nessesary

https://gnunet.org/
https://ipfs.io/
https://datproject.org/
http://orbit.chat/ [...]

I have seen IPFS JavaScript implementation earlier and it has some notification system. As I see current implementation of IPFS (in oribit.chat) uses asm.js, so protocol is too havy I think. IPFS have no version control and implementating it by myself is not good choice for me. As opposite as I see Dat project is control version system but I know nothing about storing and speed of distribution information in it. But I think it an option if protocol for it is not so havy. Or, maybe, IPFS protocol is not so havy but and asm.js uses because of portability of Go code?
